source_text: As we go deeper into contact work it becomes much more than just about contacting ETs, it really has a lot to do with the evolution of consciousness and the evolution of your planet.
We cannot separate the two.
The process that consciousness takes from the experience of separation to the experience of reintegration.
Coincidentally it's the same process that happens during the contact experience - simply...

When you live a human life, your life seems continuous and solid, but if you start meditating or you start spiritual practices, you'll start to notice that the quality of reality changes, your consciousness expands, and you begin to travel to another realm in your conciousness.
Ever wonder if there's intelligent life elsewhere in the universe?
Well, I have....I've been wondering since I was a kid.
My name is Reuben Langdon.
And on March 29th 2007, in the middle of the day, I saw a number of strange objects in the sky.
Coincidentally, I was working on the film Avatar at the time, playing an alien.
And ever since then I've been on a quest...
A quest to find out if aliens really do exist and if so... ...are they here with us?
If beings of higher intelligence are here... ...what is their purpose?
Why don't they make themselves more known?
Why the secrecy?
I've asked these questions to many experts, yet each seems to have a different theory.
So I thought to myself, why not ask the aliens directly?
So that's what I set out to do!
Well, sort of...
All right.
Hello to you, this is Sasha.
Hi Sasha.
Nice to see you today.
Nice to see you.
Thanks for being here and being part of this big adventure show that I've got going on.
It is our pleasure.
First, I'd like to sort of ask... ...what density do you reside in?
We are within what you would call the higher levels of fourth density.
Oh.
So we still have physical bodies.
OK.
But we know that our planet and our people is making-- on our way to making the transition to no longer having bodies.
So-- so almost-- well, fifth-- my understanding-- and I could be wrong-- but fifth-- fifth, sixth density would be more losing the body sense.
But on the fourth density as well?
In the scale that we use, which is seven densities--
Right.
--the fourth density is the last density in which physicality is expressed as a separate body.
OK.
As you begin moving into fifth density, then you become more plasmic in nature.
I see.
So you could kind of say light beings.
OK.
But as you go farther and farther, deeper and deeper into fifth density, then it becomes less individualized and you start moving more toward collective.
Would-- are dream states be a fifth density reality?
What density would you classify the dreams in?
Well, this is a metaphor that we've used in the past for another project.
We're going to resurrect it here because it's very useful.
Mm-hmm.
If you consider the idea of a golden lake to be your state of oneness in complete integration, the state of sleep is the time when, in a sense, you revisit, or reconnect, with that state of oneness.
So we wouldn't say that it is necessarily a separate density.
The dream state is another expression of consciousness as you are reconnecting with your true nature.
I see.
So it's not even-- it's almost in its own classification.
Exactly.
Sort of like angelic realms.
Well, angelic realms I've heard are borderline somewhere around seventh-- sixth, seventh, eighth density sort of thing.
But is that-- do they have a classification?
Well, based on what you're saying, it seems we're using different scales.
I see.
Yes. OK.
So obviously, the answers are going to be a little bit confusing.
For us, it's a seven density scale.
OK.
So we consider the angelic realm to be more sixth density.
OK.
All right.

This is good because I-- you know, having, again, this scale or base to ask questions from and sort of go back and forth, it helps the audience sort of put the pieces of the puzzle together, formulate their own ideas.
Yes. >> Because a lot of the same-- sometimes, we use same terminologies, but, like we just noticed, that it might be just slightly a little bit different.
Yes.
If we will-- if we can say just a little bit more about density, just to give a broader perspective--
Yes.
--for those who are listening.
The best way to describe our version of the communications about density is to liken it to the idea of a rainbow.

So when you have the original white light that then passes through a prism and becomes a rainbow, those seven light frequencies that you see are kind of representative of the idea of the densities of consciousness.
But if you look at them very closely, a rainbow for instance--
Yes.
--there's not a sharp division between each one.
Right. >> There's a gradation.
Correct, yeah.
So consciousness, thus, moves from its original state of oneness through the fragmentation and through series of different types of expression.
The densest being third density, which is where humanity is leaving from, because it's egoic based.
OK.
And then, you begin moving out of that ego-based reality and back into the collective.
I've also-- wonderful analogy.
I've also-- most of the analogies I've heard it's sort of related to the chakra system, which, again, is related to the rainbow.
So it's--
Yes, exactly.
It sort of goes full circle.
Exactly.
So, you know, I've heard that our plant and animal kingdom are second density consciousness.
Yes.
As we are moving into fourth density, and we're sort of in that blending of the rainbow phase, I would say early phase, where are our animals-- are they blending into the third density?
Ah.
OK.
There are two ways to look at this idea.
One is a linear way and one is a holographic way.
OK.
OK.
So if you are to look at it from the perspective of linearity, which is what humans are more familiar with--
Yes.
--then what you would see is that the other species and the other consciousness around you is moving also.

So from the linear perspective, you're going to find that the species on your world that you might consider the higher second density species, such as the primates, and certain bird species, et cetera, they are, too, making a transition to third density, which means, then, the development of ego.
So you're starting to see even in dogs and certain animals more symptoms of ego.
Ego, of course, not meaning a negative thing.
Ego is simply a mechanism that grounds you in the experience of separation for a higher purpose.
Mm-hmm.
OK.
So in that sense, then, that's the linear--
Right.
--perspective.
Now, if you were to look at the holographic principle of this idea, we're going-- again, we have to speak in metaphors.
Yes.
We're going to ask you to imagine seven rooms that nest inside each other like boxes-- like those Japanese boxes.
Yes?
OK.
Right.
And the bigger box that contains the smaller boxes would be more representative of seventh density.
OK.
OK.
So from the holographic perspective, you exist in all of those boxes, thus in all of the densities.
And it's simply a matter of perspective about the you that is choosing to notice the experience it's having at any given time.
But it is all simultaneous.
So in that sense, there's no movement, linearly--
Right.
--from one density to another.
It's a complete expression, a complete experience on all levels, simultaneously.
Right.
I saw-- would that relate to platonic solids or geometrical shapes--
Exactly, yes.
--as well?
There's a great video I just saw online-- maybe I'll post it, here, in this video-- where all of these platonic solids were inside each other.
Exactly.
And they sort of pull them apart.
Exactly.
The platonic solids are a wonderful metaphor for the density energy and also for the evolution of consciousness as it moves from separation back into integration.
There is one workshop we do where we actually equate each of the densities to different platonic solids.
Oh, perfect.
OK.
It's the same idea, yes.
Oh, excellent.
And would that mean, then, our first density minerals and, you know, rocks and these sorts of-- is water, I guess, consider a first density being?
Yes.
Yes.
Would-- would that sort of move into the second density, then, and start having sentient consciousness?
Well, the thing about first density-- again, we're-- we're challenged by the two perspectives, linear and holographic.
Right, I guess what I'm saying is in a linear sense.
In a linear sense.
Yeah.
In a linear sense, we have to say that the first density, consciousness, is a little bit different.
OK.
Because the first density consciousness, being the first manifestation into the reality of separation, is the building blocks of creation.
So it's your periodic table of the elements.
Mm-hmm.
It's all those-- that stuff of creation.
Right.
Now, the higher forms, then, like high first density would be the mineral kingdom, as an example.
Oh, I see.
OK.
And--
Oh, OK, OK.
So-- >> Yes.
So just like with our-- for, like, you guys being on a higher end of the fourth density spectrum-- so you still have physical bodies like us.
The craft that you probably fly around in-- and where we're just now entering that phase, but we're still in that fourth density classification.
OK.
So it's a spectrum.
Right.
It's an entire spectrum.
But the difference you're gonna see-- because you humans are now entering the fourth density beginnings.
Right.
And we're toward the end.
The biggest difference you're going to see between the two of us is what we call the egoic anchor.
OK.
So ours is not as heavy, so to speak.

From your time of evolution, if you can remember this or have records of this in your era, what was, in relative years-- earth years, your linear evolution from beginnings of fourth density to where you are now?

Well, the-- our-- looking at it linearly, we went through very similar type of evolution that you are going through now, however, we would say that our challenges, as a species, were different than yours.
So for us, a lot of our challenges had to do with self-forgiveness, guilt, things that we were holding on to as a young species that we then had to learn how to transcend.

And for a very, very long period of time, those challenges for my species really stopped our evolution and almost destroyed us as a species because when you keep putting-- pushing down the emotional things that need to be explored, you can-- well, our species created a plague, so to speak.
A plague, oh, wow.
Plague, yes.
Similar to what you might call an immune plague where a disease within our immune systems was destroying us and we had no idea what it was.
And we had to use our connections with, you might call them the angels, or the guardians of our species, the guides of our species-- we had to connect with them to find out what it was.
And what we found out was that our pattern, as a species, was that we were refusing to look at and integrate what you call the shadow.
OK. Oh, I see.
So we were keeping that separation.
And once we could learn to integrate the shadow and the light within us, this was a significant nexus point in our fourth density evolution-- third fourth density evolution.
Once we were able to make that integration, then the plague healed itself and our consciousness began evolving.
Into fourth density.
Yes.
And was that a long time ago?
Or time wise, in a linear sense, are you able to put a time stamp on it?
Oh, it's very difficult because, as you know, timelines don't line up.
Sure.
But it was long enough ago-- if we were to pinpoint a time on your world, it would have been before late, late dinosaur time.
OK.
So we're talking thousands of years.
Millions.
Millions of years.
Yes.
In fourth density, right now, since that evolution to it.
Again, the timelines don't line up.
OK.
Right.
Yeah, I understand.
It's very-- it's really impossible to answer.
The evolution-- generally speaking, the evolution of a physical species does take a very, very long time.
Now, it depends on the species.
It depends on the genetic work that's been done on the species.
It depends on what they're holding on to, what they're willing to let go of.
So everyone's process is different.
Right.
Through these interactions, I've learned that we all create our own realities.
Is it possible for an individual to go into a timeline where the collective evolution of the species is accelerated, if the individual is willing to do that work, so to say.
And then-- and not bypass the collective, but go into a timeline where that collective evolution is super fast?
Well, that's really the only way to change timelines.
It's not-- as you said, it's not a matter of bypassing, it's more a matter of resonance.
Right, OK.

So we've given-- we believe you've heard it on tape, we've given a little bit of what we call the quantum map, which talks about how the reality stream or the time stream is very similar to like the blinking of eyes.
You don't notice your eyes are blinking all day.
Right.
But that is how the physical-- the physical universe continues to express itself is through bursts.
And each time-- it's like an in breath and an out breath.
So each time there is an in breath, which is like the blinking of an eye, you realign with a new frequency structure.
And that's how time-- that's how you, in a sense, jump timelines.
We do have to say, though, that the ego cannot direct this at all.
Right.
So.
So, so it's a release of the ego in order to do that.
Exactly.
Right.
So it's not-- and, consciously, there's almost-- it's almost-- you can't-- almost can't do it consciously because of--
Exactly.
--the ego is part of this conscious mental mind--
Exactly.
--where we have-- where we're trying to guide, where we're trying to steer the ship.
Exactly.
And you have to sort of let go of the steering wheel to get there. >> Exactly.
The ego has-- it has very significant needs.
Right.
And it will always, let's say, default to those needs--
Right.
--before it will default to the evolution of consciousness.
Right.
Because then it dies, so to speak.
Yes.
It's almost like going to the mountain and doing the hard training.
And, then, you know, after all the hard training, you realize that, you know, to get to this enlightened state, there's no training necessary.
Exactly, my dear.
Exactly.
Excellent.
So it-- I kind of want to go back to the Pleiades and your star system now.
We have this definition of the Pleiades--
Yes.
--of, you know, the-- is it the Six Sisters?
Seven Sisters?
Seven Sisters, yes.
Seven Sisters.
And there's obviously-- because if you look through a micros-- or a telescope, you can see a lot more stars than just the seven stars that we see.
Yes.
We-- we realize we did take a tangent off into something else from what you were asking.
Basically speaking, we're actually going to jump back and answer part of this question and the other question that you had before.
Basically speaking, the beings that you know of as Pleiadians are not indigenous to the area that you know of as Pleiades.
All right.
OK.
So we have, basically, two genetic lines.
One comes from the ancient Lyra.
OK.
And one comes from the ancient Lyra combined with Earth genetics.
That's another story, perhaps for another time.
So there's two different lines that eventually colonized in the area that you know of as Pleiades.
So not really the Seven Sisters.
However, in the ancient days, when my people would visit your people on Earth, and we would be asked where are we from, well, if we pointed to those seven stars--
Right.
--in that direction, they got the point.
I see. now the idea of humanity being a mixture well of course, it's no surprise to you that you know that there is a genetic connection between us.
Yes.
And it comes from many, many different sources, some of which is the Lyran-- the original Lyran template DNA and Pleiadians evolving from that.
And then, also, working with the genetics on Earth.
But we find this idea of simply looking at it genetically to be extremely limiting because nobody is indigenous to anywhere.
You are originally one.
Correct.
So again, we have to use metaphor.
Yes.

If you take holographic film-- and the nature of holographic film is that if we were to take a picture of an apple and then cut up the film in tiny pieces, each tiny little piece would have the complete image of the apple.
And it doesn't matter how small you cut those pieces.
Right.
So consciousness is fractal in that way.
Yes.
And therefore, no matter if you are a lowly human, so to speak, on Earth, here, at this time, you are fractally and holographically every other piece as well.
Correct.
So in that sense, then, the question is difficult to answer because our default setting is not linear.
Right.
And yet language is linear.
So you mean the Pleiadian-- where you are in your evolution--
Yes. >> --is not linear, correct?
Yes.
And in our human system, our human OS, is sort of in a linear sense.
Yes.
So we're trying to match those.
Yes.
But you're really shifting.
Yeah.
My understanding is that the Pleiadian is a very feminine energy.
Is that correct?
Or is it very balanced, in that sense?
I always perceived, or felt, more feminine energy, archetypal energy, related to the Pleiadian energy.
Yes.

Well, what you're going to find with-- again, not a simple answer to the question-- what you're going to find with my species, as well as many of the other core species in your galactic family, is that there's generally three eras of development.
The first era is more of the infant species.
And it is in that first era where the issues, let's say, of each species that need to be healed, come up.
All right.
And then the second era tends to be the healing period when the integration starts, the healing happens.
The third era, which is, of course, the mature era, is when awakening, as a species, happens.
So my species, particularly, is felt as feminine in all three eras, which is really interesting.
And it's kind of rare because many of the other species are more felt masculine.
OK.
But the reason we are felt more feminine in all three eras is because as follows.
First era, we already told you that the tendency for my species was to not want to look at the shadow.
So we were kind of floating around in the spiritual bubble.
Right.
All right, which is actually an unbalanced feminine energy.
Mm-hmm.
OK.
Then, when you go to the second era, and the integration happens, integration, or the act of integration, by its very nature is feminine because it's inclusive.
So all of that integration was creating a movement inward, which is a very feminine energy.
And then, of course, in the third era, which is the awakened era, you have a species that is very balanced male female energy that is in an awakened state.
And to a separated consciousness on Earth, that state feels very feminine.
So that's why I-- we're-- you know, myself and other people get that feeling.
Exactly.
And-- and this is going into some other races, but I was told that-- my understanding is that the Anunnaki were a hybrid race of Pleiadian and Draconian energies.
Is that-- do you see it from that perspective?
No.
We're going to be a little bit of a rebel, here.
Sure.
Because the word Anunnaki in your Sumerian language, as far as we understand the definition, means those who have come down.
OK.
So Anunnaki is meaning, basically, those who came from the heavens.
OK.
So they were not one species.
I see.
They were many.
I see.
Oh, OK.
That-- well, that clears up a lot of stuff.
A lot of questions I had.
Yes.
So that-- that is interesting.
You know, we were trying to figure out why-- where did the Anunnaki get all this DNA the old story of enslaving-- making humans for slaves--
Yes.
--for mining gold.
And that was only one particular family that did that.
OK.
But as you know, they're the ones that get the bad rap, yes?
Right.
Right.
The rotten apple spoils the bunch.
I see.
So speaking of DNA and when that race of beings, or that family, took all these various DNAs from different star systems and created the human structure, um, how did that work in the beginning?
Or was there this-- again, this-- there had to be an agreement of sorts, otherwise it wouldn't have happened.
Of course, there's always an agreement.
Yeah.
However, again, we have to say that-- we have to look at it from a non-human perspective.
Now, you're quite familiar with other channeled information and such talking about, basically, if something is happening, or something is arising, there must be a higher purpose.
And that is not, in any way, meant to be a cop out.
All right.
It's simply the way the universe works.
Sure.
There is no mistakes--
Absolutely.
--in creation.
Now, in those ancient days, we have to say that your Earth, or your solar system, could be likened to what you call the wild, wild west.
Yeah.
Feels like that today, still, but--
Well, yes, it is.
It is.
But it's a little bit more colonized now.
Sure.
So it was an isolated place.
And because of that isolation, a lot went on, that was very fragmented with groups, one group having one agenda, one group having another agenda and conflicts and things such as that.
All because these forefathers of yours were a very young species.
This doesn't happen with older species.
Only with younger ones.
I see.
So you sort of answered the question earlier, that, yes, there was some sort of higher purpose.
And therefore, these other races sort of lend their DNA for this higher purpose.
Yes.
It wasn't stolen or taken and put-- you know, I'm going to go drug the Arcturian and then grab some DNA or some mojo--
Yes.
That makes a wonderful science fiction movie.
Sure.
But it's not quite the way things work.
Sure.

One of the things that we've said to many people, sometimes, that ask questions about this is that from the perspective outside of the Earth, or from a fourth density perspective, let's say, this idea of the sharing of DNA and the shaping of cultures using DNA is actually a very natural process.
It's kind of like pollination--
Right.
--on your world.
And when you look at it-- when you remove the victim-perpetrator idea--
Right.
--which is really only applicable in a very polarized third density reality, then the whole paradigm changes, actually.
Right.
But the question, then, is why?
Why do people have these experiences of being a victim and things such as that.
Sure.
Why do those buttons get pushed?

Well, when you are a third-density species, in a sense, you can say there are many passages, spiritual passages, that you have to go through in order to evolve your consciousness on the way to fourth density.
One of those passages has to do with the healing of the clinging to the idea of victim and perpetrator.
And many civilizations get stuck there for millennia.
And so when you have-- well, we're bringing in another tangent, here.
No, that's fine.
But when you have the situation with the Zetas and the so-called abductions, it triggered the same issues humanity has been playing out for so many thousands of years, but this time from space.
Are there victims?
Are there perpetrators?

And on the individual level of those who were claiming abduction, the reason it's happening is because they have to pass through that gate in order to shift their consciousness and integrate the polarity within themselves.
And then, on a collective level, it happens on a collective level, as well, that changing of the paradigm.
And therefore, a passage into fourth density can be made, or one of the steps of the passage.
So without the Zeta abduction, temporary detainment, experience, then, we wouldn't even have the opportunity to heal that wound to move into fourth density.
Exactly.
Or you would have re-created something else.
Some other scenario.
Yes.
Yeah, we would have.
But at least we got to have it in that way so we could connect to our cosmic family.
Exactly.
As opposed to, you know, making another story on Earth.
Yes, because in the Orion civilization, they didn't create that-- the healing of that through the ET contact.
They created it through a domineering empire.
Right.
And that was the Orion Wars?
Yes.
Was-- was the Pleiadian-- your society involved in those wars?
Shamefully, yes.
We're making a joke.
Right.
Now, again, those conflicts lasted for a very, very long time.
So there was a period of time, when my species was very young, that our mindset was kind of like a teenager in your human counting.
You know, gung ho, do this, jump in without thinking of the consequences.
Right.
And so we did that.
And as you say in your vernacular, got our asses kicked.
And that brought up the issues of the guilt and all that kind of stuff that we had to work on as a species in order to make our shift.
So in that way, there's nothing extraneous.
So now, obviously, that period of time is over and, hopefully, the Orion-- and we say now.
And obviously time-- and I guess, you know, I'm just-- where you are with your evolution, you've cleared that up.
You've been through that.
You've had this-- we have the story of the Orion Wars to tell to-- so we can keep-- you heal--
Yes.
--some future generations.
Because hey, we've been there, we've done that.
Yes.
And there are some residuals finishing up on your world, as well.
Right.
With the Orion Wars.
Yes.
OK.
And because again-- so I've-- you know, I've heard this analogy that everything that's happening on Earth is sort of-- the micro and the macro, so--
Yes.
--you know, if we go back just 20 years maybe in our timeline, then the Orion Wars are still happening kind of in a way, depending on which timeline we're in, I guess.
It really depends on what you are connecting with, energetically.
Right.
And so that-- instead of looking at it from a linear sense, the vibrational frequency of where we're at, if we're vibrating at that frequency, then, yes, the Orion Wars are still happening.
Exactly.
OK.
For instance, people in your world who live in the Middle East, who are embroiled in extreme polarity and extreme control--
Yeah.
--are directly connecting, still, to that era of Orion.
Right.
Whereas, perhaps, you, in your daily life, are not.
Correct.
I see.
So instead of seeing time linearly in that sense, it's just more of a vibrational frequency.
Yes, and it's very fluid.
Right.
And that-- so we can sort of see time in our daily lives, too.
And if we can see everything as a vibrational frequency, then, maybe we can get through, navigate through this frequency soup, I like to call it, a little bit easier.
Yes.
You're in a very-- as you well know, you're in a very interesting time right now, because in a sense you have one foot in third density, one foot in fourth.
You're taking the foot out of third density.
But because it's a spectrum, and there's a gradation as the energy changes, you're still going to have challenges with the old way of doing things as the new structures are arising.
Right.
So this is really the most tenuous time and also the most challenging one.
Right.
But also the most--
Exciting.
--exciting because the shift, the daily shifts, are happening at such an exponential rate that we really can take notice.
Yes.
And see these changes.
Yes.
And that's exciting.
Exactly, yes.
Exciting.
And it's exciting for us to watch, too.
Right.

Exactly. we're having this conversation with Lisa and Ron, earlier, about the-- we call it the Mandela Effect, is the internet terminology for what seems to be, from one perspective, a shifting of timelines.
Yes.
And it's almost now been labeled.
Now, we have a collective name for it.
And we're seeing pieces in our history shifting from the way we remember it.
Yes.
And we're going back and reviewing movies and tangible, physical things, that the way we remembered them, they weren't that way before.
Yes.
Is this the actual shifting of timelines?
It is the you-- as we were just talking about a moment ago, time is more fluid.
Right.
When you are rooted, let's say, in third density, time feels and is perceived as being more fixed.
But now you're moving more into a fluid sense of time.
And that means, then, that you are-- again, it's a metaphor.
It's the limit of the language.
Sure.
You are spending more time in the quantum state of consciousness where all possibilities exist.
Right.
And you are, thus, able to-- remember, we were talking about the blinking in and out, or the in and out breath.
Right.
You are able to shift the timelines much more rapidly.
But in the past when you did it, you didn't remember the previous one.
But now, as you are spending more time in the quantum, you're becoming more familiar and comfortable with that energy, that you're starting to remember the other parallels.
Not in a schizophrenic way, but in a way that's meant to just tell-- that's meant to just show you--
Right.
--look how fluid you are becoming, you are unlocking.
And that's where the excitement-- you know, this is-- >> Yes.
So now, you're beginning to see that the future-- you've always seen the future as fluid, but now, you're seeing the past as fluid, too.
Exactly.
And-- and we can rewrite the story if we want to.
Yes, but the ego can never rewrite anything.
Ah, the ego.
Yes.
Yes, yes, ah, the ego.
Interesting.
This is where people who do manifestation work get stuck.
Ah, yes.
Because the ego takes over the show.
Right.
I can see that.
I can absolutely see that.
So we want to rewrite the story, but we can't really rewrite the story.
We just have to-- we can't rewrite the past story, but we can rewrite the now story with our choices.
Yes.
You can rewrite the now story.
Now, when we talk about now, we're talking about now.
Right.
And now.
And now.
We're not talking about one second from now.
Sure.
All right.
So the only thing, then, that you have in the now is your experience of the now.
Right.
So therefore, what you are really rewriting is your experience of the now--
Right.
--which really has to do with your interpretation of the now.
And that, depending on that interpretation, will set us on a specific vibrational frequency.
Exactly.
And then, depending on that vibrational frequency, we see the past rewrite itself.
Exactly.
So if your interpretation of the now is one of victimization--
Sure.
--guess what you're going to get.
We're going to get a past history of Zetas abducting you every night against your will.
Yes.
And if you are at a vibrational frequency of non-victimization, empowerment, then, you're going to be going on the ships and donating your stuff instead of actually being taken against your will.
Yes.
And even-- getting out-- getting out of the ET stuff-- even we're talking about, is your boss picking on you at work?
Sure.
So we're even talking about the human stuff here.
Right.
Right.
And then, shifting that perspective, shifting that now moment, now all of a sudden your boss is not picking on you, but got a greater plan or, you know, something, some other story.
Exactly.
